alert.note: Alert for Morgan; Scott (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 13 at 6:44PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT MORGAN AND SCOTT COUNTIES THROUGH 830 PM EDT... At 743 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 9 miles south of Jamestown to 13 miles west of Wartburg to near Fairfield Glade to 6 miles east of Crossville. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Oneida, Wartburg, Huntsville, Helenwood, Winfield, Sunbright, Rugby, Coalfield, High Point, and Smokey Junction. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Morristown.
